verses.verse: A false <S%H4820><s%> balance <S%H3976><s%> is an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> But a just <S%H8003><s%> weight <S%H68><s%> is His delight. <S%H7522><s%>
When pride <S%H2087><s%> comes, <S%H935><s%> then comes <S%H935><s%> dishonor, <S%H7036><s%> But with the humble <S%H9492><s%> is wisdom. <S%H2451><s%>
The integrity <S%H8538><s%> of the upright <S%H3477><s%> will guide <S%H5148><s%> them, But the falseness <S%H5558><s%> of the treacherous <S%H898><s%> will destroy <S%H7703><s%> them.
Riches <S%H1952><s%> do not profit <S%H3276><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of wrath, <S%H5678><s%> But righteousness <S%H6666><s%> delivers <S%H5337><s%> from death. <S%H4194><s%>

The righteousness <S%H6666><s%> of the blameless <S%H8549><s%> will smooth <S%H3474><s%> his way, <S%H1870><s%> But the wicked <S%H7563><s%> will fall <S%H5307><s%> by his own wickedness. <S%H7564><s%>
The righteousness <S%H6666><s%> of the upright <S%H3477><s%> will deliver <S%H5337><s%> them, But the treacherous <S%H898><s%> will be caught <S%H3920><s%> by [their own] greed. <S%H1942><s%>
When a wicked <S%H7563><s%> man <S%H120><s%> dies, <S%H4194><s%> [his] expectation <S%H8615><s%> will perish, And the hope <S%H6><s%> of strong <S%H8431><s%> men <S%H202><s%> perishes.
The righteous <S%H6662><s%> is delivered <S%H2502><s%> from trouble, <S%H6869><s%> But the wicked <S%H7563><s%> takes <S%H935><s%> his place. <S%H8478><s%>

With [his] mouth <S%H6310><s%> the godless <S%H2611><s%> man <S%H2611><s%> destroys <S%H7843><s%> his neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> But through knowledge <S%H1847><s%> the righteous <S%H6662><s%> will be delivered. <S%H2502><s%>

When it goes well <S%H2898><s%> with the righteous, <S%H6662><s%> the city <S%H7151><s%> rejoices, <S%H5970><s%> And when the wicked <S%H7563><s%> perish, there is glad <S%H6><s%> shouting. <S%H7440><s%>

By the blessing <S%H1293><s%> of the upright <S%H3477><s%> a city <S%H7176><s%> is exalted, <S%H7311><s%> But by the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> it is torn <S%H2040><s%> down. <S%H2040><s%>
He who despises <S%H936><s%> his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> lacks <S%H2638><s%> sense, <S%H3820><s%> But a man <S%H376><s%> of understanding <S%H8394><s%> keeps <S%H2790><s%> silent. <S%H2790><s%>

He who goes <S%H1980><s%> about as a talebearer <S%H7400><s%> reveals <S%H1540><s%> secrets, <S%H5475><s%> But he who is trustworthy <S%H539><s%> <S%H7307><s%> conceals <S%H3680><s%> a matter. <S%H1697><s%>

Where there <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> guidance, <S%H8458><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> fall, <S%H5307><s%> But in abundance <S%H7230><s%> of counselors <S%H3289><s%> there is victory. <S%H8668><s%>

He who is surety <S%H6148><s%> for a stranger <S%H2114><s%> will surely <S%H9563><s%> suffer <S%H7489><s%> for it, But he who hates <S%H8130><s%> going <S%H8628><s%> surety <S%H8628><s%> is safe. <S%H982><s%>
A gracious <S%H2580><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> attains <S%H8551><s%> honor, <S%H9202><s%> And violent <S%H6184><s%> men <S%H6184><s%> attain <S%H8551><s%> riches. <S%H6239><s%>

The merciful <S%H2617><s%> man <S%H376><s%> does <S%H1580><s%> himself <S%H5315><s%> good, <S%H2617><s%> But the cruel <S%H394><s%> man <S%H394><s%> does <S%H5916><s%> himself <S%H7607><s%> harm. <S%H5916><s%>
The wicked <S%H7563><s%> earns <S%H6213><s%> deceptive <S%H8267><s%> wages, <S%H7938><s%> But he who sows <S%H2232><s%> righteousness <S%H6666><s%> [gets] a true <S%H571><s%> reward. <S%H7938><s%>

He who <S%H9210><s%> is steadfast <S%H9210><s%> in righteousness <S%H6666><s%> [will attain] to life, <S%H9132><s%> And he who pursues <S%H7291><s%> evil <S%H9567><s%> [will bring about] his own death. <S%H4194><s%>

The perverse <S%H6141><s%> in heart <S%H3820><s%> are an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> But the blameless <S%H8549><s%> in [their] walk <S%H1870><s%> are His delight. <S%H7522><s%>

Assuredly, <S%H3027><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%> man <S%H7451><s%> will not go <S%H5352><s%> unpunished, <S%H5352><s%> But the descendants <S%H2233><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> will be delivered. <S%H4422><s%>
[As] a ring <S%H5141><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%> in a swine's snout, <S%H639><s%> [So is] a beautiful <S%H3303><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> who lacks <S%H5493><s%> discretion. <S%H2940><s%>
The desire <S%H8378><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> is only <S%H389><s%> good, <S%H9185><s%> [But] the expectation <S%H8615><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is wrath. <S%H5678><s%>

There <S%H3426><s%> is one who scatters, <S%H6340><s%> yet increases <S%H3254><s%> all <S%H5750><s%> the more, <S%H5750><s%> And there is one who withholds <S%H2820><s%> what <S%H3476><s%> is justly <S%H3476><s%> due, <S%H3476><s%> but [it results] only <S%H389><s%> in want. <S%H4270><s%>
The generous <S%H1293><s%> man <S%H5315><s%> will be prosperous, <S%H1878><s%> And he who waters <S%H7301><s%> will himself <S%H1931><s%> be watered. <S%H9196><s%>

He who withholds <S%H4513><s%> grain, <S%H1250><s%> the people <S%H3816><s%> will curse <S%H6895><s%> him, But blessing <S%H1293><s%> will be on the head <S%H7218><s%> of him who sells <S%H7666><s%> [it.]

He who diligently <S%H7836><s%> seeks <S%H7836><s%> good <S%H9185><s%> seeks <S%H1245><s%> favor, <S%H7522><s%> But he who searches <S%H1875><s%> after evil, <S%H9567><s%> it will come <S%H935><s%> to him.
He who trusts <S%H982><s%> in his riches <S%H6239><s%> will fall, <S%H5307><s%> But the righteous <S%H6662><s%> will flourish <S%H6524><s%> like the [green] leaf. <S%H5929><s%>
He who troubles <S%H5916><s%> his own house <S%H1004><s%> will inherit <S%H5157><s%> wind, <S%H7307><s%> And the foolish <S%H191><s%> will be servant <S%H5650><s%> to the wisehearted. <S%H2450><s%>
The fruit <S%H6529><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> is a tree <S%H6086><s%> of life, <S%H9132><s%> And he who is wise <S%H2450><s%> wins <S%H3947><s%> souls. <S%H5315><s%>

If <S%H2005><s%> the righteous <S%H6662><s%> will be rewarded <S%H9608><s%> in the earth, <S%H776><s%> How <S%H637><s%> much <S%H637><s%> <S%H3588><s%> more <S%H637><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> and the sinner! <S%H2398><s%>
